result.execSummary:
The defendant David Alan Mundth was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Hate Crime], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Hate Crime], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages or nonprescription controlled substances, or any prescription medicine for which the defendant does not have a current prescription.
Defendant shall not enter into any establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages.
Defendant shall not threaten or engage in any violent or abusive conduct directed toward Juan Carlos Luevano-Arellano & Rafael David Hernandez-Garcia.

Defendant shall consent to a reasonable request of a law enforcement officer, based on probable cause, to submit to a breath, blood, saliva, or urine test for purposes of determining the quantity of alcohol or drugs in defendant's breath, blood, saliva, or urine.
Defendant shall participate in any and all counseling deemed appropriate by the Division of Community Corrections.
Defendant shall abide by all other terms and conditions of probation deemed appropriate by the Division of Community Corrections.
Defendant shall undergo an AODA assessment and follow through with all recommendations thereof.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 9:06 AM.
Defendant David Alan Mundth in court with attorney Jane Ellen Bucher.   Katherine Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Bucher informs the court this matter is resolved.
Defendant withdrawals plea of "NOT GUILTY" and enters a plea of "NO CONTEST" to both counts.
The court finds there is a factual basis.
Court questions defendant re: plea and waiver of rights.
Court also questions attorney Bucher re: plea and waiver of rights.
Court finds plea and waiver is made freely, knowingly & intelligently.
Court accepts plea and finds the defendant "GUILTY" to both counts.
State moves for joint recommendation of the parties - plea agreement.
Attorney Bucher concurs with the state and moves for plea agreement.
Defendant makes statement to the court.
Court grants motion of the parties, and orders the defendant be placed on probation for a period of 18 months with conditions (concurrent).
>  Defendant shall undergo an AODA assessment and follow through with all recommendations thereof.
>  Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcoholic beverages or nonprescription controlled substances, or any prescription medicine for which the defendant does not have a current prescription.
Defendant shall not enter into any establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages.
>  Defendant shall consent to a reasonable request of a law enforcement officer, based on probable cause, to submit to a breath, blood, saliva, or urine test for purposes of determining the quantity of alcohol or drugs in defendant's breath, blood, saliva, or urine.
>  Defendant shall participate in any and all counseling deemed appropriate by the Division of Community Corrections.
>  Defendant shall not threaten or engage in any violent or abusive conduct directed toward Juan Carlos Luevano-Arellano & Rafael David Hernandez-Garcia
>  Defendant shall abide by all other terms and conditions of probation deemed appropriate by the Division of Community Corrections.
> Defendant shall pay costs in the matter
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 19, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Case called at 9:06 AM.
Defendant David Alan Mundth in court with attorney Jane Ellen Bucher.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Bucher informs the court an offer has been made, and moves to continue for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 19, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Scheduling conference on July 29, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial on September 14, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial on September 29, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant David Alan Mundth in court with attorney Jane Ellen Bucher.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Bucher informs the court this matter is close to resolution and moves to continue for 30 days.
State moves to set for trial.
Status conference on June 21, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Case called at 2:39 PM.
Defendant David Alan Mundth in court with attorney Jane Ellen Bucher.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Bucher informs the court that an offer has been made and moves to continue for a counter offer.
No objection.  Status conference scheduled for June 21, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on May 3, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Case called at 9:18 AM.
Defendant David Alan Mundth in court with attorney Jane Ellen Bucher.  Katherine M. Findley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Bucher files DDI
Defendant stands "MUTE"
Court enters plea of "NOT GUILTY" on behalf of the defendant.
  Status conference scheduled for May 3, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Case called at 9:07 AM.
David Mundth appears in person with attorney Jane Bucher appears for intake purpose only for today's hearing, DA Findley appears on behalf of the State of Wisconsin.
Court finds probable cause for filing.
State requests $1,000.00 signature bond, no conditions.
Defendant acknowledges criminal complaint, court reads charge portion onto the record.
Continue for adjourned initial appearance.
